title: MEAS MECH_ENG 454-0-20 Numerical Methods in Optimal Control of Nonlinear Systems

instructors.instructor_addr: Technological Institute, Rm B286, 2145 Sheridan Rd, EV CAMPUS

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course covers numerical optimal control with an emphasis on engineering applications and computation. Topics include gradient descent, Newton's method, optimal control, and optimal switching control. Examples will be drawn largely from aerospace, robotics, and biomedical applications.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: The prerequisites are differential equations and systems analysis. Undergraduate controls and/or signal processing course would satisfy this requirement. A graduate-level systems course is also helpful, but not necessary.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Iterative Methods for Optimization (Frontiers in Applied Mathematics), C. T. Kelley, 1987, Society for Industrial Mathematics, ISBN 978-0898714333.
